explanation: This code defines a JavaScript function named 'greeting' that logs the string 'Hello World' to the console.
This code defines a JavaScript function named 'addNumbers' that takes two parameters, 'a' and 'b', and returns their sum.
This code defines a JavaScript function named 'multiplyNumbers' that takes two parameters, 'a' and 'b', and returns their product.
This code creates an array called 'fruits' with three elements: 'apple', 'banana', and 'orange'. Then, it logs the length of the array to the console.

This code declares a variable 'x' and assigns it a value of 5. It then checks if 'x' is greater than 0. If it is, it logs the string 'Positive number' to the console; otherwise, it logs 'Negative number'.
This HTML code displays the text 'Hello, World!' as a heading level 5.
This HTML code creates a paragraph containing the text 'This is a paragraph.'.
This HTML code defines an unordered list with a class 'list' and contains three list items: 'Item 1', 'Item 2', and 'Item 3'.
This HTML code creates a hyperlink with the text 'Visit Example' that points to the URL 'https://www.example.com'.
This HTML code inserts an image with the source 'image.webp' and the alternate text 'Image'.
This CSS code sets the background color of the body element to '#f2f2f2'.
This CSS code sets the color of all h1 elements to red.
This CSS code sets the font size of all p elements to 18 pixels.
This CSS code adds a 1-pixel solid black border to all div elements.
This CSS code targets elements with the class 'container' and sets their width to 100%, height to 300 pixels, and background color to lightblue.
This JavaScript function named 'power' takes two parameters, 'base' and 'exponent', and returns the result of raising the 'base' to the 'exponent'.
This JavaScript function named 'sumArray' takes an array as a parameter and uses the 'reduce' method to calculate the sum of all the numbers in the array.
This JavaScript function named 'capitalize' takes a string as a parameter and returns the string with the first character capitalized.
This JavaScript function named 'reverseArray' takes an array as a parameter and reverses the order of its elements.

This JavaScript function named 'findAverage' takes an array as a parameter, calculates the sum of its elements using the 'reduce' method, and returns the average by dividing the sum by the length of the array.

This JavaScript function named 'removeFalsyValues' takes an array as a parameter and uses the 'filter' method with the 'Boolean' function to remove all falsy values (e.g., false, null, 0, '', undefined, NaN) from the array.

This JavaScript function named 'getRandomNumber' takes a minimum value 'min' and a maximum value 'max' as parameters. It uses the 'Math.random' function to generate a random number between 'min' and 'max', inclusive, and then rounds it down to the nearest integer using 'Math.floor'.

This JavaScript function named 'formatDate' takes a date object as a parameter. It defines an 'options' object with the desired date formatting options. It then uses the 'toLocaleDateString' method with the 'en-US' locale and the 'options' object to format the date as a string with the full month name, day, and year in numeric format.

This JavaScript function named 'removeDuplicates' takes an array as a parameter. It utilizes the 'Set' object to remove duplicate elements from the array by converting it to a Set and then spreading it back into an array using the spread syntax.

This JavaScript function named 'calculateHypotenuse' takes the lengths of the two sides of a right triangle, 'a' and 'b', as parameters. It uses the Pythagorean theorem to calculate and return the length of the hypotenuse by taking the square root of the sum of the squares of 'a' and 'b'.

This JavaScript function named 'countOccurrences' takes an array 'arr' and a number 'num' as parameters. It uses the 'filter' method to create a new array containing only the elements that are equal to 'num'. The length of the filtered array is then returned, representing the count of occurrences of 'num' in 'arr'.

This JavaScript function named 'getRandomElement' takes an array 'arr' as a parameter. It generates a random index by multiplying 'Math.random()' with the length of the array and flooring the result using 'Math.floor()'. It then returns the element at the randomly generated index from the array.

This JavaScript function named 'removeFalsyProperties' takes an object 'obj' as a parameter. It uses the 'Object.entries' method to get an array of key-value pairs from the object. It then applies the 'filter' method on the key-value pairs array, keeping only the entries where the value is truthy. Finally, it converts the filtered array back to an object using 'Object.fromEntries' and returns it.

This JavaScript function named 'truncateString' takes a string 'str' and a maximum length 'maxLength' as parameters. It checks if the length of the string is greater than the maximum length. If it is, the string is truncated using the 'slice' method to extract the substring from index 0 to 'maxLength', and '...' is appended. If the string is not longer than the maximum length, it is returned as is.

This JavaScript function named 'getUniqueValues' takes an array 'arr' as a parameter. It utilizes the 'Set' object to remove duplicate elements from the array by converting it to a Set and then spreading it back into an array using the spread syntax. The resulting array contains only unique values.
This HTML code represents a level 2 heading element (<h2>) displaying the text 'Welcome to My Website'.

This HTML code represents a paragraph element (

) containing the text 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit'.

element with the class 'container'. It contains a level 3 heading element (

) displaying the text 'Content', and a paragraph element (

This HTML code represents a hyperlink element (<a>) with the 'href' attribute set to '#' and displaying the text 'Click Me'.
This HTML code represents an image element () with the 'src' attribute set to 'image.jpg' and the 'alt' attribute set to 'Image'.
This HTML code represents an unordered list element (<ul>) containing three list item elements (<li>) with the texts 'Item 1', 'Item 2', and 'Item 3'.

About Us

We are a team of developers.
explanation:
This HTML code represents a level 4 heading element (

) displaying the text 'About Us', followed by a paragraph element (

) containing the text 'We are a team of developers'.

This HTML code represents a table element (<table>) with two table rows (<tr>). The first row contains two table header cells (<th>) with the texts 'Name' and 'Age'. The second row contains two table data cells (<td>) with the texts 'John' and '25'.

code:
<form action="/submit" method="POST">
  <input type="text" name="username" placeholder="Enter your username">
  <input type="password" name="password" placeholder="Enter your password">
  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>
explanation: This HTML code represents a form element (<form>) with the 'action' attribute set to '/submit' and the 'method' attribute set to 'POST'. Inside the form, there are two input elements (<input>) - one with 'type' set to 'text' and 'name' set to 'username', and the other with 'type' set to 'password' and 'name' set to 'password'. Both inputs have placeholder attributes. Lastly, there is a button element (<button>) with 'type' set to 'submit' and displaying the text 'Submit'.

This HTML code represents a navigation element (<nav>). Inside the navigation element, there are three hyperlink elements (<a>) with 'href' attributes set to '#' and displaying the texts 'Home', 'About', and 'Contact'.

This HTML code represents a label element (<label>) with the 'for' attribute set to 'name' and displaying the text 'Name:'. It is followed by an input element (<input>) with the 'type' attribute set to 'text', the 'id' attribute set to 'name', and the 'name' attribute set to 'name'.
This HTML code represents a header element (<header>) containing a level 1 heading element (<h1>) displaying the text 'My Website'.

This CSS code sets the font family of the body element to Arial or a sans-serif font.
This CSS code sets the color of h1 headings to blue and the font size to 24 pixels.
This CSS code adds a bottom margin of 10 pixels to paragraphs (p elements).
This CSS code targets elements with the class 'container' and sets their width to 100%, maximum width to 800 pixels, centers them horizontally with auto margins, and adds 20 pixels of padding.
This CSS code sets the color of links (a elements) to a specific shade of blue (#337ab7) and removes the underline text decoration.
This CSS code sets the list-style type of list items (li elements) within unordered lists (ul elements) to a disc shape and adds a left margin of 20 pixels.
This CSS code targets text input fields (input elements with the type attribute set to 'text') and sets their width to 200 pixels and adds 5 pixels of padding.
This CSS code sets the font size of h2 headings to 20 pixels and makes them bold by adjusting the font weight.
This CSS code sets the table element to collapse its borders (remove the space between cells) and occupy 100% of its parent's width.
This CSS code targets elements with the class 'header' and sets their background color to a specific shade of gray (#f2f2f2) and adds 10 pixels of padding.
This CSS code adds a top margin of 10 pixels to form elements.

This CSS code targets elements with the class 'btn' and sets their background color to a specific shade of blue (#337ab7), text color to white (#fff), padding to 5 pixels vertically and 10 pixels horizontally, and adds a border radius of 3 pixels.
This CSS code targets footer elements and sets their background color to a specific shade of gray (#f2f2f2), adds 10 pixels of padding, and aligns the text in the center.
This CSS code targets elements with the class 'section' and adds a bottom margin of 20 pixels.
This CSS code targets elements with the class 'error' and sets their text color to red.
